page.title: 17WILMSLOW'S BRONZE AGE MAN
page.content: In Autumn 1984 a{Bronze Age}body was found in some peat workings on Lindow Moss.He was nicknamed Lindow Pete. His elbow was damaged and his left ear was bent.He was lying on his side and only the upper part of his body was found. His nails were manicured which shows that he was not involved in heavy work.He had a ginger beard and moustache.They say he had fox fur round his arm but otherwise he was naked.When they turned him over they found the garrotte.He was hit on the head at least twice then garrotted, after that his throat was slit with a knife.He is believed to have been a{human sacrifice.}They say his last meal was bread. The body will be exhibited in the {British Museum}from 1986.
